alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, Columbia and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Edgefield and McCormick. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas and ponding of water on roadways is expected in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Evans, Martinez, Augusta, Augusta National Golf Club, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Summerville, Daniel Field, Augusta Mall, Midtown, Glendale, Augusta Regional Airport, Savannah Rapids Park, Ninety Nine Islands, Westport, Village at Riverwatch Shopping Center, Waverly, Westwick, Eisenhower Park and Savannah Bluffs Heritage Preserve. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina near mile marker 0. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 195 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
